org.cripac.isee.vpe.util.tracking

Class FileDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cripac.isee.vpe.util.tracking.FileDescriptor

  • public class FileDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object
    The FileDescriptor stores the folder hierarchy and NAME of a file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileDescriptor(java.lang.String name)
      Create a configuration file descriptor with its NAME.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getConcatName()
      Get the concatenated NAME of this configuration file containing all the information of the hierarchy.
      java.lang.String getPath()
      Get the path of this configuration file relative to the most upper folder known to the descriptor.
      FileDescriptor wrap(java.lang.String folderName)
      Indicate that the given folder further contains the containing folder hierarchy of this configuration file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • FileDescriptor

        public FileDescriptor(@Nonnull
                      java.lang.String name)
        Create a configuration file descriptor with its NAME.
        Parameters:
        name - The NAME of the configuration file.

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        public FileDescriptor wrap(@Nonnull
                           java.lang.String folderName)
        Indicate that the given folder further contains the containing folder hierarchy of this configuration file.
        Parameters:
        folderName - The NAME of the outer folder.
        Returns:
        The descriptor itself.

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Get the path of this configuration file relative to the most upper folder known to the descriptor.
        Returns:
        The relative path of this configuraiton file.

      • getConcatName

        public java.lang.String getConcatName()
        Get the concatenated NAME of this configuration file containing all the information of the hierarchy.
        Returns:
        The concatenated NAME.
